result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyoka N Giles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge. To be paid out of up to 25% of prison wages. Any balance as a condition of Extended Supervision.  if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
*Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the  Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after serving three (3) years of Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with victims or their families.
No contact with Anthony W. or Travis L.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.
Cognitive behavior therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessarby the department.

supervisions.notes:
Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that she may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

Defendant Tyoka N Giles in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $0 (zero).

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 7 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 4 years with credit for 6 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
 
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with victims or their families.
*No contact with Anthony W. or Travis L.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years of initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Tyoka N Giles in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order received, signed, and filed with court.

Defendant Tyoka N Giles in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tyoka N Giles in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Brandon Wigley for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyoka N Giles in court with attorney Jeffry R Schwartz.  Defendant Tyoka N Giles in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
